noTimeSeriesData.title: No Time Series Data
noTimeSeriesData.message: Please upload a dataset with datetime columns to enable forecasting.

descriptions.movingAverage: Simple moving average smooths data by averaging values over a sliding window. Good for data with no clear trend or seasonality.
descriptions.exponentialSmoothing: Exponential smoothing gives more weight to recent observations. Can handle trend and seasonality. Good for most time series data.
descriptions.linearTrend: Linear trend fits a straight line through the data. Best for data with a clear linear trend and minimal seasonality.

parameters.title: Method Parameters
parameters.windowSizeHelp: Number of previous values to average. Larger values create smoother forecasts.
parameters.alphaHelp: Controls how much weight is given to recent observations (0.1-0.9).
parameters.betaHelp: Controls trend component. Set to 0 to disable trend.
parameters.gammaHelp: Controls seasonal component. Set to 0 to disable seasonality.
parameters.seasonalPeriodsHelp: Length of seasonal cycle (e.g., 12 for monthly data, 7 for daily).
parameters.polynomialDegreeHelp: Higher degrees can capture more complex trends but may overfit.

configuration.title: Forecast Configuration
configuration.forecastHorizonHelp: Number of future periods to forecast.
configuration.trainTestSplitHelp: Fraction of data used for training (0.1-0.95).

validation.noTimeSeriesData: No time series data available. Please upload data with datetime columns.
validation.insufficientData: Insufficient data for forecasting. Please provide at least 10 data points.
validation.windowSizeTooLarge: Window size must be smaller than the data length.
validation.invalidForecastHorizon: Forecast horizon must be greater than 0.
validation.invalidTrainTestSplit: Train/test split must be between 0 and 1.

metrics.title: Forecast Accuracy Metrics
metrics.description: Lower values indicate better forecast accuracy. Best performing methods are highlighted.
metrics.noResults: No forecast results available. Run a forecast to see accuracy metrics.
